unnormalised: **Automotive: Understanding New Traffic Regulations in Delhi-NCR**
normalised: **Automotive: Understanding New Traffic Regulations in Delhi-N C R**

unnormalised: New Delhi, Oct 26, 2023 – The Delhi Traffic Police have implemented updated traffic regulations effective immediately to improve road safety and reduce congestion, particularly during peak hours. These changes, influenced by recommendations from IIT-Delhi’s Transportation Research Department, primarily target violations like reckless driving and illegal parking.
normalised: New Delhi, october twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – The Delhi Traffic Police have implemented updated traffic regulations effective immediately to improve road safety and reduce congestion, particularly during peak hours. These changes, influenced by recommendations from I I T-Delhi’s Transportation Research Department, primarily target violations like reckless driving and illegal parking.

unnormalised: Speed limits have been revised on several key stretches, including the Delhi-Gurgaon Expressway, with maximum speeds capped at 60 kmph between 07:00 hrs and 11:00 hrs and again from 17:00 hrs to 21:00 hrs. Fines for first-time offenders caught speeding will be Rs. 2000, escalating for repeat offenses.
normalised: Speed limits have been revised on several key stretches, including the Delhi-Gurgaon Expressway, with maximum speeds capped at sixty kilometer per hour between seven hundred hours and eleven hundred hours and again from seventeen hundred hours to twenty one hundred hours. Fines for first-time offenders caught speeding will be rupee two thousand, escalating for repeat offenses.

unnormalised: Furthermore, stringent rules against drunk driving will be enforced, especially leading up to Diwali on November 12th. Breathalyzer tests will be ramped up at checkpoints across the city. Violators face potential license suspension and hefty fines.
normalised: Furthermore, stringent rules against drunk driving will be enforced, especially leading up to Diwali on november twelfth. Breathalyzer tests will be ramped up at checkpoints across the city. Violators face potential license suspension and hefty fines.

unnormalised: The 'Parivahan' app is now updated with real-time traffic information and allows citizens to report violations. Additional awareness campaigns, featuring Bollywood celebrity endorsements, are planned to educate the public on these vital changes.
normalised: The 'Parivahan' app is now updated with real-time traffic information and allows citizens to report violations. Additional awareness campaigns, featuring Bollywood celebrity endorsements, are planned to educate the public on these vital changes.
